alert.note: Alert for East Central Tularosa Basin, Alamogordo; East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Otero Mesa; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 8:36PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Otero County through 915 PM MDT... At 836 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sunspot, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cloudcroft, Sunspot, High Rolls, Mountain Park, Sixteen Springs, James Canyon, Benson Ridge, Cox Canyon, Karr Canyon, Dry Canyon, Oliver Lee State Park, and Bluff Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: East Central Tularosa Basin, Alamogordo; East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Otero Mesa; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
